comments:
I did the following procedure: Install CDT, but on an incompatible eclipse
version. Installed Eclipse 3.0 M6 into a fresh directory (but kept workspace
settings) and used "Software Update/Find and Install" to install the new CDT.
Installation passes without problems (have to grant write rights manually for
the plugin/features directory before). Restart of Eclipse failes (this confirms
bug #39924, I think).  Starting Eclipse again works ok, but neither C++
Perspective nor C++ Projects are available. 
In the "Software Updates/Manage Configuration"-Panel the CDT is marked broken,
with the message "No plug-in: "org.eclipse.cdt.core.linux" included at runtime."
attached to "Eclipse C/C++ Developement Tools (Linux GTK) 2.0.0". 
I do not know if this is a hint, but no subdirectories for the cdt appear in
workspace/.metadata/.plugins.

During installation the following exception gets written to the .log, but based
on the timestamp I guess it only applies to the "restart after install"-bug #39924:

!SESSION ----------------------------------------------------------------------

Build/distribution problem, Doug any ideas on this ?

I solved the problem by installing Eclipse into my home directory. Seems a
rights problem, and it is very likely that I messed it up myself, as I am pretty
new to Linux. However, maybe some installation hints can be given to the web
page? I got the tip to install it to my home directory from the newsgroup.

> I solved the problem by installing Eclipse into my home directory. Seems a
> rights problem, and it is very likely that I messed it up myself, as I am pretty
> new to Linux. However, maybe some installation hints can be given to the web
> page? I got the tip to install it to my home directory from the newsgroup.

Ok, Status change to Fix

About the tip for the install, Doug is on the Cc:.
But we do have an installation page under www.eclipse.org/cdt

If you send a patch reformating the wording that would be good.
